Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: hasletthoney
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here based on other reviews in TA. A place of this size competing with and besting some major hotels in the area says a lot. It is new and clean to my standards ( a rarity). The beds were so comfortable my husband, who has back trouble, commented on how well he slept. The breakfast was adequete: ceareal, waffles, juice, coffee, toast, muffins, bagels, yogurt and various juices and hot drinks. While close to the airport the noise didn't bother us and we live it the country where it's always quiet. We had a car and learned to get around the city. We were visiting family and not there to gamble. The non smoking policy and our trip through the crowded strip area made us very glad we had chosen this place.

Reviews.Title: “Far From the Crowds for a Peaceful Retreat”
Reviews.Author: TripGypsi
Reviews.Content: I love Vegas, love the shows, but not cigarette smoke! When traveling to Las Vegas for business and to attend conferences, I relish a chance to retreat back to my hotel room to regroup and get work done. This is the place! As long as you have a car, this hotel is close enough to get to the conference quickly. There are no crowds, no smoke, no loud gaming machines. I was able to get from conference, back to the room to change, then off to a show, with very little difficulty or rushing around. The rooms are new, clean, and comfy. The exercize room does the job, and the front desk staff are welcoming and professional. While the neighborhood is clearly industrial on the south side of the airport, it felt safe, and I did not hear the planes. The breakfast room is large and comfy, and the hot waffles are delicious. Everybody in the room seemed to be in a good mood, and a little girl was thrilled to watch the planes take off while she enjoyed the waffles and syrup!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: TrinaPM
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating! I stayed here during the weekend for a workshop and they provided much more than expected. This is not far from the strip and airport. Room had refrigerator and was told if you get in a room and it doesn't have one, just ask them and they will bring one up to you.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, decent value, poor restaurant choices if walking...”
Reviews.Author: MikefromSeattle
Reviews.Content: New hotel where we stayed for one nite prior to an early morning flight. Staff was helpful and positive. Shuttle to airport (and other locations) available. Room was clean and spacious. Continental breakfast was merely adequate. Business center allowed for free computer and Internet access. Only two restaurant possibilites if you do not have a car and choose to walk (pub with a full menu or a pizza place - both in strip malls down the street).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: travelingbuckeye2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel starting with the friendly check-in staff! Convenient to all attractions including the Strip, Hoover Dam and Red Rock Canyon. Shuttle service is reliable and timely. Stops include the Tropicana on the Strip, airport locations and Town Square. Rooms are new and up-to-date. They include a Keurig coffee maker, bottled water, frig, and microwave and comfortable beds with soft sheets. Breakfast was great - including the waffles. Ate out by the pool and watched the planes land at the airport. Rooms were very quiet considering how close to the airport the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location away from the strip and near the airport”
Reviews.Author: PBACedarburg
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay for a family trip thru Vegas airport with travel to other destinations in Arizona, Utah, or Nevada. Clean. Comfortable. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, excellent pool, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quendall
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newly built, so it is nicer than most other LQ's. The rooms are absolutely beautiful wiith tall ceilings, nice bathrooms and lots of little extras. A kuerig is in each room (I didnt use it but its nice to have!) And free bottled water in the fridge. The beds were super comfy. The grounds and pool were great....a plus is that the pool and sauna were open 24 hours. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alkonost45
Reviews.Content: Great staff and rooms. Good shuttle service to/from airport. Call the hotel for the shuttle when you deplane as it takes about 20 minutes to get from the hotel to the airport. Breakfast OK if you like biscuits and gravy. Oddball Internet connection - connectivity is excellent but the service times out frequently and you need to enter a password and agree TOS again to reconnect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MelNFV
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in Vegas and decided to try the La Quinta South based on other traveller's reviews. The hotel still smells new, is very quiet and clean, comfortable beds and nice bathroom (good water pressure in the shower). We had a room close to the elevators but didn't hear a thing. I didn't find it close to the strip. Breakfast was good, although they did run out of milk when we were there (I was lucky enough to grab the last carton). Clean, convenient, friendly staff... great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “New and clean”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to airport and strip. NEW! Clean and friendly. We always stay at La Quinta because we travel with our small dog. There was even a nice little doggie area complete with benches and poopy bag stand. Recommended. My husband found the bed a little soft, but...you can't please everyone all the time...right?

Reviews.Title: “Good thinking!”
Reviews.Author: Migratory_Margie
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel near the airport for an early morning departure. The room was lovely, with granite countertops, a Keurig coffee machine, and comfortable bedding. It had LOTS of electric outlets, which was good thinking and rare in hotel rooms. We recharged everything after a week in Death Valley. Plus it was very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cilla W
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The staff is friendly and helpful. Ellen at the front desk is a doll. It's clean, comfortable, spacious and almost brand new. Between the free breakfast, internet and water in the room, you can't beat the value. I travel to Vegas for meetings that happen a few blocks away so for me it's the best. There is a free shuttle to the strip, but that's not my priority when there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel.....very clean, beautiful....great price. Everyone who worked there were very helpful....I will make sure to stay again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: leorock
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with great service, free breakfast, and free shuttle to the Strip, the airport, Town Square and the nearby Walmart. It has been in service for 11/2 year, so it's almost brand new. Clean sheets and towels all the time and also clean room and bathroom, bed was really comfortable. My room had refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker with coffee and tea provided by the hotel. Big LCD TV, 40 something inches screen with a decent selection of channels, coin laundry room and detergent sold in front desk and also dry cleaning service provided but I never used it. When you arrive to the airport you MUST call the hotel and ask them to send the shuttle, the shuttle service is on demand only, and you have to take it at level zero of the airport, just across the street by the limousine parking space, you will see a blue sign also. I have seen some reviews here saying that the hotel is close to The Strip, that's wrong, the hotel is NOT close to The Strip, those people are reviewing another La Quinta hotel that is located north of the airport. The hotel is very quiet, very family friendly specially for people that don't want to expose children to casinos and gambling and also excellent for business trips. Keep in mind that it is located in a business area so there are only a few places around to buy something to eat (7/11, Taco bell, Mc Donalds and a couple more), there is food delivery available but I could only see Pizza delivery. The hotel also provides with free WiFi and wired internet, and a free business center in case you need to print something or if you forgot your laptop. I stayed at this hotel for more than 20 days.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: TexasHazelnuts
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this clean, very nice hotel. Best value for your money in Vegas, I'm betting. We spent one night before heading out to the Grand Canyon. The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: CoalOhio
Reviews.Content: We were arriving late in Vegas and decided to spend the night before making our drive to Mesquite. Based on the positive reviews, we chose this place and we were very happy with this choice. The rooms were very nice - a beautiful bathroom and a comfy bed. The hotel's location was convenient to both the airport and the strip.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Airport South is a great deal”
Reviews.Author: Sparshatt
Reviews.Content: We had one night in downtown Las Vegas and had to get out!! So my wife and I looked on Trip Advisor and Booking.com and saw the great reviews about this hotel............so we gave it a shot. I have to say that we were totally impressed........the hotel is new, the rooms are great, it is 100% non-smoking, the pool is lovely, the breakfast is free, etc, etc, etc. However what really makes this place great is the staff, and the excellent minibus service that they provide. The staff are young, enthusiastic, cheerful, and honest with their advice. The minibus service runs free....and 24/7......and generally they will drop off and pick up from the airport, car rental facilities, the Las Vegas strip and Town Square Mall (which is a beautiful nearby mall with great shops and restaurants....where the locals go.) Oh - and the air is clean............the airport is nearby, but you don't hear a thing from the rooms................

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: halifamous
Reviews.Content: I had such a great stay at La Quinta. I didn't expect much by the airport and after staying a week on the strip in a fancy place. I couldn't have been happier by the service, room cleanliness/comfort and cozy beds. The staff went above and beyond in customer service. I'd highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if you need to be close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: dabbler45
Reviews.Content: Our plane arrived late at night (according to our home time zone) and we didn't want to get the rental car until the next day, so we stayed here. The hotel shuttle pickup was pretty prompt, the checkin was easy, the front desk people were pleasant and the room was spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and we were not bothered by airplane noise except around 6 AM. The breakfast was ok, not great and not horrible. The very nice shuttle driver wasn't busy so he took us to the Car Rental Center instead of the airport. That was great and saved us both time and an extra wait for an extra shuttle. We picked up our car, returned to the hotel, packed up, checked out, and were on our way. Very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice La Quinta Inn”
Reviews.Author: Susieq4158
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta Airport South was a wonderful place to stay. The rooms were very comfortable and also very pleasing to the eye. It still looks brand new. The beds were 5 star. The front desk service was on spot superb. The shuttle comes to the airport within minutes and was driven by a young man that was very pleasant. When I needed to get my rental car in the morning, same young man was again very pleasant, good driver and gave me great directions. The continental breakfast was very substantial. I would stay in this hotel again in a second. I like to be away from the craziness of the city when I want to rest and this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: kosborneDraper_Ut
Reviews.Content: I travel alone from Salt Lake to Santa Barbara several times each year. I now take my two rat terriers with me and need a place that accepts pets. La Quinta is great. The rooms are very clean and comfortable with excellent beds and pillows. They have a doggy area outside complete with doggy bags and reminders to clean up after using. The staff is friendly and even if I get in late there is hot water for tea and often hot coffee in the coffee pot. Apples, bananas, hot cereal are available for travelers who arrive a bit hungry. While the "girls" can tell that there have been other four legged guests, the rooms always smell clean and fresh to me. It is the best of both worlds as my dogs are happy and so am I. Oh, there is a breakfast bar in the morning too. I would highly recommend La Quinta to others who travel with pets, as well as those who don't.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: darrylwk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a year ago then were back again but the hotel is still in excellent shape. I am a bit picky about clean if I pay a decent price and this place easily passes my critique. The beds in here are some of those most comfy and plush I've used in motels and are above average. The pillows are big and fluffy yet supportive and the older I get the more I appreciate that! The bathroom itself is tiny but its always nice to have a separate sink area like this hotel. The pool is big and clean but best of all nice and warm for January weather. I like that there are restrooms next to it for washing and changing. There is also a privacy screen on the fence that also helps block wind. The Jacuzzi is clean and huge and not to hot. There breakfast is as nice or nicer then comparable motels and I enjoy the savings and convenience of not going out. There is a Walmart only about a mile Wesr and South and nice restaurants West on Sunset. The area seems undated, safe and clean so its great for families. I'm willing to pay a bit extra for the quiet and clean this place offers although Hotwire offer a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: AuntPatchy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a romantic weekend in Vegas. We got a great deal on a jaccuzi suite. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was standard and they had new help that was a little clueless, but overall it was good. They did forget our luggage when they picked us up from the strip after we checked out and left it at the bell desk. But we made it with no problem to our flight after they went back and got it. Very apologetic and courteous. Overall the staff was great. Cute hotel. Free Shuttles to the strip. Right next to the runway of the airport which didn't bother me, but might some people.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpensive and cute”
Reviews.Author: JuanCR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel the last night of our trip to Arizona and Las Vegas, since it it very close to the car rental drop of before taking our flight back home. The hotel fells like new, good parking, great rooms and beds, good breakfast. Besides they have a free shutle to the Strip, so you dont have to drive to there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in town!”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper03
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that we stay at every time in town. Vegas is our half way mark in a road trip that we make multiple times a year. We usual travel with our dog so we need a hotel that allows pets. La Quinta is perfect for this! With the free shuttle we are able to enjoy the strip without driving our car around and dealing with parking. They drop you off at the MGM Grand and you can take the tram to several other casinos along the way or walk in good weather. The breakfast is tasty. However, the biscuits are on the stale side EVERY time we go there. I have learned a trick around this: microwave them with a mug of hot water. It works like a charm. Other than the stale biscuits the only thing I would change about their breakfast is to have more options for jelly. It seems like every time I go all that is left is apple. Yuck. The staff is very nice and helpful. Sometimes they have fresh cookies at the counter. They have saved us in a pinch with free travel supplies when necessary. And the check in process is very quick. The rooms are VERY nice and clean. Its a rather new hotel so in the last year (4 seperate stays) we havent been in a room we didnt like. They all smell great, are clean, and feel relaxing. Some hotels on the strip can make you feel like you need a bath. No worries with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: cancunkitty
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that the reason I stayed at this hotel was because of the great reviews here on Tripadvisor. My husband and I stayed here on New Years Eve because of a last minute trip we planned to Las Vegas. We did not want to spend $400 on a room for that night so I searched this site and found this hotel. It was extremely affordable and one of the best values for my money that I have ever gotten! We usually go to Vegas a few times a year and I have never felt inclined to review any of the hotels, but I felt this was such a great find and value that I wanted to help other people. Now, this is hotel is NOT on the strip. It is about 10 minutes from the action and adjacent to the airport. That being said, it is easy to get to the strip and back. I was surprised that the noise level from the airport was virtually nonexistent. Check in and check out was one of the easiest I have ever experienced. The room was super clean and brand new. My husband loved the LARGE flatscreen TV with tons of channels. The bathroom was very nice and clean as well. There was also a fridge, microwave, and Keurig machine. The bed was one of the best I have slept on while in vacation. We even used the jacuzzie facility and it was wonderful. We transfered over to another hotel on the strip for the remainder of our trip and we were sorry we did so. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who does not mind not being on the strip!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: farmergirl4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Laquinta South During our Christmas holidays. We decided at the last minute to switch from our reservations form the Excalibur, thanks to many bad reviews on trip advisor, and move over to LaQuinta. Let me tell you, that was the best decision we made, EVER! The hotel was fabulous! Very clean, mostly quiet (you get use to the airport). Pretty decent breakfast. Free Shuttle. Friendly staff. Warm cookies at night ( kids liked that one!) We would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mayasmama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here - him for the first 4 days for business and I joined the tail end and we were both very impressed. It literally was of BETTER quality as the $200 p/night Disneyland Hotel we stayed in earlier this year. Fridge, Microwave, Keurig with 6 drink selections, Granite bathroom vanity, large showerhead, flat screen TV, comfortable bedding...truly high quality comfortable stay. Beautiful building inside/out as well! Runs alongside the landing strip of McCarren airport, but barely could hear them inside the room. Moved to Luxor later on to stay @ a casino and heard more flight traffic in there. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay with pets”
Reviews.Author: wanderer31310
Reviews.Content: We usually pick La Quintas when traveling with our dog and this was a nice property, relatively new, very clean and staff was nice. Linens were new and updated-duvet as opposed to those horrible bedspreads, and mattresses were comfortable. On the negative side, the doors to the rooms were very noisy when closing and there was no fan in the bathroom. The 24 hr shuttle is certainly a plus and despite being very close to the airport runway, we did not hear any airport noise.

Reviews.Title: “really nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: gardenstate029
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, king bed comfortable, feather bed on top was a little too mushy for me, but that's personal preference. Whirlpool tub in room was fantastic and only airport hotel that offers this. Good variety continental breakfast, hotel shuttle picked me up at airport when I called them on arrival, arranged shuttle for the next morning the night before. Very clean, new facility, friendly staff. Minor complaint: Had arranged for early check in, but turns out "early check in" means 1 p.m. and I was there at 11 a.m. (I had told them I would be there around 11), had to wait about 20 mins for room to be ready. Also, set up wake up call for the next a.m., for some reason got three wake up calls in a row! (that definitely woke me up!) Did not use room service or pool or other amenities. Great price, too. One more thing...the airport noise is NOT a big deal at all, occasionally heard a big one landing, but it's not like you're standing on the tarmac. The convenience of closeness to the airport is worth hearing an occasional plane land. Glad I chose this place and I will again if I'm ever back in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean, and convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: SelwaySteward
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed three nights, at two different times and I could not have been more pleased with the La Quinta, airport south. I was in search of a quiet, clean, and smoke free place while laying over in Las Vegas and this hotel was perfect. The bed was wonderful, the room clean, and good towels. The service was excellent and the free shuttle to the airport and the strip was very convenient. AND, there wasn't a single slot machine in the place, which was great. For bgeing so close to the airport it was suprisingly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Budget Friendly”
Reviews.Author: CTS80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this La Quinta while driving from Colorado to California. We had our 2-year-old son and our dog with us, so we choose La Quinta because they do not charge a fee for the dog. We stayed in the suite for one night. The room was quite large, which was great because our son could walk around a bit after a long day in the car. The room was also very, very clean, which I really appreciate. There was a television in the living area where our son slept and an additional television in the separate bedroom. Bathroom was large and very clean. We slept well, but one should be aware that this hotel is basically across the street from the airport. Our room was facing the airport, so we were very close. The noise did not bother us and it entertained our son for quite some time. However, you may want to ask for a room on the opposite side of the hotel is you are sensitive to the noise. Did it sound like a 747 was going to come into our room? No, but, we could hear the dull roar of jet planes. They seemed to stop from about 10pm-6am (though maybe I was too tired to hear them?). Despite the background noise, I would not hesitate to stay here again. It was clean and very comfortable for the price. Breakfast is nothing to get overly excited about, but it is always nice to grab a yogurt and a banana for the road.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Alternative to the Mega Resorts”
Reviews.Author: Artwrk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with my wife and two kids. This newer hotel is off the strip in a fairly quiet location. The airport is literally across the street, but the sound was not an issue. The check-in was quick and the staff was courteous and professional. The entire property was clean and well maintained. The room was very nice with a large flat panel t.v., comfortable beds, and a Keurig coffee maker with a nice assortment of coffee's, teas, and cocoa. The breakfast in the morning was ample and included waffles, fresh fruit, cereals, bagels, oatmeal, etc. There is not much to do in the immediate vicinity, and having a car is essential. The hotel does offer a shuttle to the strip (a service we did not use). Overall we had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. It was a nice change from the chaos of the mega resorts. We would definitely consider staying at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel tucked away in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JasonMckin
Reviews.Content: Friendliest staff I have experienced in years of travelling. Almost no noise from the airport nearby. The hotel itself appears to be newly constructed, extremely nice facilities. I didn't have time to take advantage of everything they had. Definitely a great alternative to staying on the strip if you have a car in Vegas. Truly a 5 out of 5 experience and one deserving of a positive review.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Frugal S
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that is close to the airport and about 5 - 10 minutes away from the Strip by car. Not recommended if you want to be within walking distance to the Strip. When we arrived, it appeared that a few of the cleaning/gardening staff (about 10 in number) were involved in an argument just outside of the foyer area which made me a little apprehensive for the safety of my family - this is the only reason why I did not give this hotel an 'Excellent' rating. The hotel itself was great. Spacious and clean interconnecting rooms - we had two rooms and the connecting door was very useful. Our rooms faced the airport but we did not hear the planes taking off or landing - so no problems with noise. Firm beds that provided us with great sleep. Clean sheets, pillows, towels etc. Clean bathroom with everything working fine. Air conditioning was great - no noise. Hot breakfast in a big room. Omelets, bagels, biscuits with grave, breads, juices, tea and coffee. Helpful and friendly staff - they were patient in answering any questions we had. Will definitely stay here on our next trip to Las Vegas, and recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fine property, but overrated on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: blossom
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here on Veterans Day (11/11/11) when strip properties were very expensive, and husband was in town on business, so the price and glowing reviews on tripadvisor made the property very appealing. The La Quinta is a year old, still in pretty good shape. Beds are very comfortable and the Keurig coffee machine in bathroom is a nice touch. Our basic king bedded room was small. We experienced some noise from the hallway. Doors seem to really slam a lot, and the sound carries. Heard a little airport noise, but it wasn't bothersome. It is located in an isolated area, but about 5 minutes from the strip. Really nothing wrong with this property, but it is just a basic motel. I've stayed in comparable Marriott properties that were a little nicer. I expected more because of all the exaggerated TA reviews saying it's an upscale property with beautiful rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Economic but basic alternative to Strip”
Reviews.Author: scouser99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern with excellent soundproofing, well-appointed rooms with quiet air-con, good firm bed and power shower. Breakfast is OK with hot choices. It is isolated with nothing attractive within walking distance. However the hotel operates a free minibus service hourly to/from the MGM/Luxor area, and also 'on request' to/from the airport, car rental depot, etc. Each trip is about 20 minutes, the young staff are pleasant and friendly. From the MGM you can get the monorail or Deuce bus to the central Strip [too far to walk] The 'pool' is merely an unheated plunge pool, no bar service [indeed no alcohol in this hotel at all!] and no dining room, just a self-service breakfast area. Food can be ordered from your room for delivery by courier. So for just B&B this is fine, as long as you don't plan to lounge around in the hotel. We booked one night only, based on price and convenience for getting away to the airport for an early flight. For a longer stay, we would look elsewhere, preferably as near to Bellagio as possible/affordable if the Strip is your bag. Bear in mind that once away from this hotel you probably won't be returning for lunch, rest, shower, dinner, etc, so you may be better in a more central hotel with more amenities. Not suitable for children [no distractions]. Free internet access [one PC & printer] at Reception. No WiFi. At booking, I asked for a room near a lift [being disabled] but was allocated a distant room miles from the lift. Bring plenty of snacks, drinks, with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sengsouriya
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - everything you want - nice beds, nice desk + a real office chair (rare to see that) and a nice flat screen TV all at a very reasonable price. One of the best values in a hotel I've ever seen - a great option to avoid the hassle of the strip but also offers a shuttle to the strip if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good hotel, free shuttles to the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: tempoeffects
Reviews.Content: The price difference between this and hotels on the Strip is enormous. With a free shuttle to the Strip, why wouldn't anyone want to stay here. I was expecting a modest motel - but the quality of the breakfast, beds, room upkeep, bathroom etc. blew me away. The room was extremely well done up, with dark wooden panels comparable to any fancy hotel. Ample, *free* parking, and I could see my parked car from the window. That was sort of important to me because I was on a multi-day trip out of Las Vegas as well and did not want to move my bags and other stuff out of the car each night that I stayed in a different hotel. The reception personnel assured me that the area was safe and that they had cameras in the parking lot. The breakfast was ample, and pleasantly surprised once again by the hot omelettes they had. I am not the biggest fan of Las Vegas, but I agree that lots of people might find its novelty quite endearing. If you're happy to experience that during the evenings but want a quieter place to come back to at night, then this is your place. It is extremely close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “another great choice thanks to tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelKatyTexas
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from the reviews from tripadvisor. It was rated # 5 at the time. Very affordable. It was off the strip but it offered a free shuttle to the airport and to the MGM hotel on the strip. We didn't need to rent a car for our stay. It was very nice and new and super clean. Extremely comfy bed. Great hotel staff. It also had free breakfast. It was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Inn”
Reviews.Author: angel5353
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times now and am booked to stay again soon, the hotel is clean and tidy the free shuttle will take you to or pick you up from town square shops the airport or the mgm grand, we used it almost everyday as we had no car, everything was great with some minor niggles, the phone did not work and on ringing down four times to get someone to fix it it was just reset which did not fix the problem so had no phone the whole of the stay! We were also given the wrong internet code on arrival so contacting my friends to let them know we had arrived was challenging also my son got his legs cut from the leaves in the pool there were a lot from the palm trees outside the hotel. the breakfast is limited mostly bagels and cereal but the fridge and microwave are an advantage and there is a walmart 10 minutes down the road we had the executive king suite with the sleeper sofa which my son found very comfortable i can recommend the pizza companys new york style cheese pizza which was very good

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeninaus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2 separate occasions. The beds were sooo comfy, we didn't want to leave! Rooms were big & clean. Wifi was free & fast. Computer in lobby to print boarding passes is really helpful. Breakfast was good, loved making waffles. Staff were very helpful, ordered us food to be delivered. Location is off the strip but close to the airport which suited our needs. The shuttle bus picked us up & dropped off at the car rental, both shuttle drivers were really friendly. Only issue was we had to wait over an hour for a pick up from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel...of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Tammy G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on an overnight after our flight was delayed for flying back to California with my mom and son. We had a wonderful stay and couldn't ask for anything else. They have a good breakfast, free wi-fi which is important for my kid, the shuttle service is FREE (unheard of in today's world) to the airport, the main area on the strip and some local mall. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was bigger than a normal hotel room and extremely well maintained. I want one of the beds...best sleep in years Don't change anything. I want to bring my husband back to visit in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lynn D
Reviews.Content: We checked in very late after a very long day of flying and layovers. We were picked up at the airport by the hotel shuttle, offered water and given assistance with our luggage. We were greeted very warmly by the staff and given directions to our room. It was very clean and comfortable. The bed was so comfortable I actually asked for information on the name brand of the mattress. We had an excellent continental breakfast the next morning. We were treated courteously and had a very positive experience. The staff helped us with the reservations and in selecting the perfect room for our comfort. This is definitely a place we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations.”
Reviews.Author: AZQCgirl
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much from this hotel, but it was wonderful. The room was really large and spacious, and everything was so clean and tasteful. The bed was really comfortable, and so was the bedding--something that you rarely find at hotels this size. The breakfast was incredible, by far the best I've seen at this type of hotel. The service was good, too. I even left something in my room after checking out, and I had no problem recovering it. I would definitely go back! Not sure what that last review is all about. We had no problem finding food, no disturbances, and we didn't have our pet with us, but our dainty little dog has no problem going in dirt or rocks, so I really don't think it's a problem! I would definitely recommend staying here...and this is not a "fake" review, either! Lol.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Fake REVIEWS!!! Wow Trip Advisor - Steered Me Wrong - Good Luck with a Dog..”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: We are in town doing a story on local hotels in Vegas outside the strip and wanted to share a few thoughts on the property. Yesterday when we called the hotel to book a room the front desk agent (name is available if needed) told us there were no rooms available when we were simultaneously checking rates online. Needless to say we booked a room on line, however this the first red flag. After checking in, we called down to the front desk, same guy answered as we inquired were the nearest place to get a sandwich for takeout would be after a long day of traveling. We were told to press *611 on our phone? After trying X611 for about 20 minutes I realized this was not working from the room phone. It was not until later that evening when I noticed our room key card that showed Dial *611 for Sunset Pizza. I was not expecting Ritz-Carlton service however this was a joke. I went online and found 20 plus places to grab food all within 1 mile radius of the hotel. Did you know your room windows do not open, or crack for that matter? I live in Colorado and like fresh air, I have never stayed at a hotel that the windows don't crack. Will they open in the event of a fire? I can see with the airport being so close the nose could be an issue. However a stuffy hotel room in Vegas is not ideal.. Last but NOT least, the property is advertised as dog friendly. This should be changed, ASAP or upgrades need to be made to accommodate dogs. There is NO grass, when I inquired a nice lady at the front desk told me were in the desert... Again, not really what I wanted to hear, luckily I had a car and was able to drive down to Sunset Park to let my dog go potty. P.S. I wasn't even going to mention the kids running up and down the halls of the hotel all evening long or the party that took place downstairs that had someone throw up all over the hallways and elevator. Does the hotel not have security?

Reviews.Title: “Don't need to gamble on this one!”
Reviews.Author: AllAboutBreakfast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the La Quinta Inn and Suites Airport South for 3 nights after consulting Trip Advisor and could not have been more satisfied. First of all this hotel is barely a year old and has never allowed smoking. For that reason the rooms are fresh and feel like few have stayed there before. The beds rival any big name, big price hotel which is great after a long day on the strip. The shuttle service at La Quinta Inn and Suites Airport Las Vegas makes this hotel nearly as convenient as any on the strip. It is very prompt and departs for the MGM Grand at the top of every hour. Simply call the front desk and the shuttle will pick you up at quarter past the hour, 24 hours a day! They have a decent FREE continental breakfast, a courtesy business center, FREE Wi-fi, and awesome cookies at the front desk every evening. There is so much to like about this hotel and if you want to leave the glitz and glamour behind each day, then there is no better choice in Las Vegas. About the staff... We noticed that the staff was all quite young but don't let that fool you. This staff is top notch! They are all very pleasant and helpful and are not at all jaded by years in the industry. Since nothing is perfect, these are the imperfections we found. The hot water in the kitchen tastes like coffee even when brewing tea. The complimentary soap is sub standard and when the bathroom door is open the entrance way there is little space to walk around, but I'm nitpicking. All in all, GREAT HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to believe it was a La Quinta!”
Reviews.Author: aspenannie Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best LaQuinta we've ever stayed in! Granted...it is across from the airport and not on the Vegas strip. We needed a comfortable night stay en route to Southern Cali and this was a perfect fit for our needs. The rooms feature high ceilings, FABULOUS comfortable beds, Keurig coffee makers and pet friendly. Downsides are: some noise from nearby rooms, no grass for the pets! We will definitely stay here again for the next drive South. Pet owners - the Sunset Park just a few blocks away is a great spot to let your dog get some exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Best La Quinta we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: philch17
Reviews.Content: We picked this La Quinta because we often travel with our small dog. Of all our La Quinta visits this was the best. The hotel has much more of an upscale feeling than we expected, and everything about it, from the quality of the bed, to the appointments in the room, the lobby, the breakfast room was a very happy experience

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: robnlinda53
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night, but enjoyed the stay. The front desk people were very friendly and helpful. The place is very nice and clean it is fairly new I guess. The breakfast was good, not a great deal of variety, but certainly enough. Only issue we had was that my son left something in the room when we were about to leave and we left the keys inside as instructed. The maids would not open the door because "they didnt have the key"......how do they clean the rooms if they dont have the keys? Anyway we had to go all the way down to the desk to get a key and back up to the room.....it really was a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...Will be back”
Reviews.Author: BeachesOrBust
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing...great value, clean, 24hr pool and amazing service. We flew in late and the hotel sent a shuttle over to pick us up right away. Very friendly and helpful shuttle driver. Easy and friendly checkin. They had a 24hr pool which was a very nice surprise. Very clean hotel..average rooms. Staff was helpful, free breakfast was average, pool was nice, great value with a free shuttle to/from the airport and strip. Great value..we will definitly be staying here again...

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay. Off the Strip if you are just passing through”
Reviews.Author: patricia186390
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel after a transatlantic flight to rest before driving on to Canyon country. Huge room with jacuzzi bath and divinely comfortable bed. A great place to recover from the flight. A nice pool but aircraft noise as the location is next to the runway. Helpful staff. A free minibus service to and from the airport, Strip and shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: springva
Reviews.Content: I had to fly in to Las Vegas on a Saturday, and the hotels on the Strip were ridiculously expensive. In looking for alternatives close to the airport, I found the La Quinta Airport South. So glad I picked it! I called them from the airport while waiting at baggage claim. When I got downstairs to the pick up location, I only had to wait a few minutes for the shuttle. The shuttle driver provided an excellent first impression - she was very friendly, professional, and she offered me a bottle of water from the cooler in the van. Perfect! We waited a couple of minutes for some Southwest employees, then it was off to the hotel. I was impressed that they had 3 staffers at the front desk to check folks in, yay! Took just a couple of minutes, then I took the elevator to my room. The room was very large, very quiet, and well appointed. I had a great night's sleep, then I enjoyed the free buffet breakfast the next morning. I needed to go pick up a rental car, so the shuttle driver said, no worries, I will take you straight to the Rental Car building near the airport - excellent. All told it was a great experience, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Very impressed with their customer service, and the nice, new hotel was also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica H
Reviews.Content: This by far is the best La Quinta and also the best hotel in Las Vegas. There service is out of this world and also they have A great shuttle to and from the strip and airport! I am defintley coming back and telling everyone I know about La Quinta!

Reviews.Title: “Super service - 24 hr shuttle to strip & airport”
Reviews.Author: KayDub
Reviews.Content: We switched our reservation to this La Quinta based on Tripadvisor reviews. So glad we did, super clean, new & helpful staff. The shuttle even picked me up from the car rental return facility. Why stay on the strip when you can get this value. Nice pool area. I noticed noise from the airport when in the pool area, but not in the room. Cant say enough good about the shuttle service to the strip and airport. Great drivers Thanks La Quinta Airport South team for making our stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Even Better Service”
Reviews.Author: Jimmie_Ray
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I was ready for a let down - I mean all these 5 start ratings - is this too good to be true? - NOPE it's true!! Wife - nice big clean room with nice furniture and bedding, marble counters, and a hair dryer. Me - ooooohhhh microwave, fridge, and a BIG flat panel TV. The shuttle service was excellent - they picked us up at the airport, and when we left the first time, they dropped us off at the car rental. When we returned from our drive to Yosemite and San Francisco, they picked us up at the car rental and brought us back for 3 more nights. About the shuttle - every hour on the hour - 24hrs a day - they drop off and pickup at the airport, AND the MGM Grand. The staff is the best - friendly, helpful and were a pleasure to talk to - they get 10 stars!!! The breakfast was OK - I am not a breakfast fan, so OK is a good rating by me. Finally, we are already planning another trip to Vegas in the spring and this is where we plan on staying the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Top service!!!”
Reviews.Author: tampagirl17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my brother for one night on our way home from a trip to Bryce . What a delight ! from our first impression with our shuttle driver, Ellen, who printed off great suggestions for a trip downtown to Wendy at the desk who arranged a trip to the mall for us. Everyone we encountered went out of their way for us. The decor was restful and very clean. though it was right across from the airport you never heard a thing. Great value,service,clean, comfortable,...All you could ask for ....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Spanish Fork Guy
Reviews.Content: We just spent 1 night at this hotel on our way home from California. I was a little worried about staying across from the airport because of the noise. I had read other reviews before I booked the room and read that noise was not a problem and it wasn't. Outside is very loud, but inside no noise. From the minute we walked in, we felt welcome. The lady at the front desk very extremely friendly and helpful. She truely cares about the people that are staying there. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The beds were amazing. Checkout was a breeze. I usually try to avoid Las Vegas all together but I will for sure be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great experience !”
Reviews.Author: Tammy C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this off strip hotel for 2 nights and had a great experience. Staff members are very friendly and at checkin Ellen and Wend were helpful in getting our family settled in our room. The room was clean and spacious and the mattresses on the beds were the BEST ever. The free breakfast and free shuttle are both good assets to the hotel especially for a family. We visit Las Vegas twice a year to and we will be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Motorcycle Friendly - Great place for travelers”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: True to their word, parked the bike under the carport part of the main entrance. In full view of the desk. It was not disturbed through the entire stay. 'Jeff' was excellent. We need an extra chair - he delivered it to the room along with extra pillows (the other half). The room is quiet and clean. There were some ferrell children running, jumping and (of course) squealing in the hall way but, this didn't last long. Poor parenting cannot be blamed on the motel staff. The pool is a bit cool. I think it was used for test screening for the walk of the penguins. The jacuzzi, wasn't. the nozzles crapped out (the timer). So ... as a hot tub, it was great. Still for the traveler ... it is a gem. Considering it is Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseInWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in September 2011, and I couldn't have been more pleased. The price was very reasonable for the level of service and comfort. And best of all, no hidden resort fees! A far too common scourge in Vegas. Great rooms...clean, very comfortable beds with pillow top mattresses. I had a great sleep here, and that's saying something since I don't usually sleep all that well in hotels. The bathroom included a bathtub and shower, which was great since I've found that many of the business type hotels that I've encountered lately only have showers installed. The free breakfast was nice, and goes beyond the usual continental fare. Saved myself a fair amount of money by eating breakfast at the hotel every morning. The pool looked nice though I didn't use it personally, and the hotel is still quite new, so everything still appears clean and fresh. I also consistently do a bedbug check in every hotel I stay, and there were no signs of any at this hotel nor online on the bedbug registry. This hotel is bedbug free. The free shuttle service to and from the airport as well as the strip was a big bonus for me--and you guessed it--saved me a another chunk of money not having to pay for taxicabs. Best of all, the staff were excellent throughout. Front desk, breakfast, cleaning, and shuttle service staff were all very friendly and extremely accommodating. To be honest, I've never encountered better in all my years of travel. These people truly take pride in their jobs and deserve to be recognized! Thanks to the staff of La Quinta for making my stay a pleasurable and memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...with a car.”
Reviews.Author: geoqwest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Read all the good stuff from other reviews and brush off the bad. This hotel overlooks the runway. But unless you are used to sleeping in cave or a pillow warehouse, the sound is not intrusive at all. Sitting by the pool, it's cool to watch the planes come or go. Hell, the kids yelling in the pool is noisier. Traffic is noisier on the strip. And the air conditioner in the rooms more than covers any remnant noise from the planes. The hotel is new and has new hotel smell, new sheet feel and new furniture firm. And the price is great at $89 plus gov't extortion fees. For me this time, it was free with La Quinta Frequent Sleeper points. But you need a car here. It is 4.5 kms from the strip, 6.6 kms to Mandelay Bay if that works for you as a reference (No my American friends, I don't know what that is in miles..or football fields). Book the car on-line cuz it's waaaay cheaper than booking in a hotel or just showing up. Use a premium charge card to avoid the insurance that will double the daily rate of the rental. All the hotels have some free parking. And you'll end up seeing more of Vegas instead of just the carpet weave passed out in a drunken stupor. Also...this is not a fault of the hotel but of the Las Vegas Airport. Find out exactly where "Level O" is at the arrivals level as that is where the La Quinta shuttle arrives. There is no one at the baggage claim to ask except workers (I HATE asking workers. It's not their job to act as tour guides to dopey tourists). I called for the shuttle but grabbed a cab as Level O wasn't worth the exploration adventure. The exit from the airport, the road network to the hotel and the ignorance of my driver resulted in a $25 cab ride...and I can see, with binoculars, the arrivals doors from my window in 303! Apparantly, you can't get here from there. But it would be a 10 minute walk across the runway. Returning to the airport though is a snap as the road layout works that direction. So...the room...3rd floor, 1 room away from the end wall to the runway, noise not a problem, nice sofa and 2 chairs, big flat screen, granite counters and shower stall, lots of lamps for light for Geezers-In-Training like myself, fast internet, microwave, fridge, coffee, iron, all new, all clean, decent breakfast...it's all here. It's a small walk (long walk for my American friends ;-) ) to a couple of largely vacant new shopping malls on the corner. The economy really is in the tank isn't it. MacDonalds close, a 7-11 on the corner, a pub and restaurant nearby. I like this place. I'm spending the next 6 nights at the Luxor. Quite honestly, I'd rather stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: ninshubur
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in early September, the first leg of a much-longer road trip. I arrived in the middle of the night and was delighted to find my reservation had been honored. I was even more delighted with my room, which had all the amenities of a much more expensive hotel, including a "K-cup" in room coffee/tea maker. The bed was lush and comfortable, I had a lovely swim in the pool and like all La Quintas, they welcomed my dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family-friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Karagw
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised with our stay here. The biggest plus was the location of the hotel--it is no where near the strip. (We were just traveling through Vegas on our way to California...I'm not a big fan of Vegas as a destination.) This was a great for me because I didn't have to worry about my kids being surrounded by pornography, gambling, rowdy college kids, etc. There were lots of family-friendly restaurants nearby (mostly standard chain restaurants and fast food). The room at La Quinta was very affordably priced and was able to accommodate my husband and me and our 4 children. We had a room with two queen beds and there was plenty of floor space for a pack'n'play for the baby. Everything was clean, the staff was friendly, the breakfast had lots of different options, and --most importantly for our kids-- the pool and hot tub were nice. They even provided pool-side towels. This hotel is RIGHT next to an airport and our room looked right out to the landing planes, but when we were in our room we could barely hear them. The noise was not an issue at all. In fact, our family thought it was kind of fun to see the big jets landing as we played in the pool. If we every stay in Vegas again, this will be where we stay. It was perfect for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Flyskies737
Reviews.Content: Love to stay here! Very clean and friendly staff. Great van pick from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not non-smoking”
Reviews.Author: TrueNorthFamily
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for one night at this hotel at the beginning of our vacation. We chose this hotel because of its great reviews on TA. Since we arrived at night we didn't want to have to search around for a place to stay. The kids enjoyed fresh cookies at the front desk and check-in was smooth. The hotel lobby is nice and clean and overall first impressions were good. Our room had two queen size comfortable beds. It was clean and appeared well taken care of. The toilet and bathtub are in a separate little room and the sink in another. There was a Kuerig coffee maker in the room and I enjoyed some tea and coffee. The room also has a nice LCD TV and fridge with two small bottled waters. My only complaint-the bathroom was not cleaned completely as there were splash marks on the mirror near the sink and a used facecloth hanging from the shower curtain rod. There was some noise from airplanes but it didn't bother me. I couldn't fall asleep for another reason-cigarette smoke! We chose this hotel for its non-smoking designation and I was so disappointed when I could smell cigarette smoke making it's way into our room. In the morning, as we walked down for breakfast, I found a guest waiting for someone with his room door opened. They were trying to cover up the cigarette smoke with an aerosol spray. At any rate, breakfast was good, not extravagant but good. Cold cereals, bagels, muffins, fruit, waffles, coffee, milk, juice. All the things you'd find in a simple breakfast and it was nice and easy. The breakfast room was clean and most guests friendly. The pool was clean and cool. There are lounge chairs and pool towels provided. You could watch countless planes land since the airport is across the road. It was fun seeing how many and what airlines were landing. Aside from the guests who polluted my clean air, this hotel is nice for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel off the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: QuixoticCanuck
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice family-friendly hotel off the Strip since we had a rental car. This hotel still feels brand new even though it has been open about a year. We had a king suite, which was great for privacy. Very comfortable bed and great to have two flat-screen tv's. Free breakfast was good - kids loved the waffle-maker. Pool and hot tub were great. No airport noise in the rooms, but very noticeable while using the outdoor pool. About a 10 minute drive to the Strip - free parking pretty much anywhere, so worked fine for us. Excellent value - no extra cost for wifi or use of the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT - VERY IMPRESSED”
Reviews.Author: lovesugar1
Reviews.Content: I did quite some research before I book this hotel for my fiancee birthday (8/21/11). Wow, the room is nice, clean, bed, pillows so soft..Open the fridge there's 2 bottle of waters welcome us after a long ride on a hot desert. Microwave, coffee maker, iron board.. Pool, spa very nice, they provide pool towels...This place fits us so well with my 2 little dogs, there's a pet area, plastics bags for dogs business...Unfortunately there's some guests did not take care their dogs business, people please respect the rules, the environment...La Quinta Inn so nice to provide us free of charge on pet fees..Breakfast is a deal breaker, bagels, hot oatmeal, cereal, waffles, apples, bananas, OJ, coffee, eggs...I hate to write this, there's a couple over 60+ of age, we been at the breakfast 2 consecutive days, that couple as well..besides enjoyed the free breakfast as everyone, this couple also took a lot of goodies, eggs, bagels, jam,...etc..put in a big La Quinta bag (2 consecutive days the time we were there). I do not mind people business, but it happens in front of you (same persons, same action)..Very shame. La Quinta so nice to provide this exclusive free breakfast, if everyone do like what this couple did, maybe one day La Quinta Inn will no longer provide free breakfast. Also La Quinta provides free shuttle to airport, MGM casino...Before I used to book at Motel6 because of the dogs, but after this trip, we decide from now on La Quinta Inn will be our sweet home away from home. That's why we sign up for a membership...We're very proud to say WE ARE LA QUINTA INN fans.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: oldmcdonald
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we had to fly home, and it was just wonderful. Everything is very well run, clean, and quiet -- just what we needed to come down from all the craziness at the Paris on the strip. They're doing everything right.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with 2 night stay.”
Reviews.Author: LillyBeBe
Reviews.Content: I have been researching Vegas for the last 8 years - where to stay, eat, shows, etc. My husband and I are in our late 20s and love to travel, but for whatever reason never could make it out here. We finally got our chance, and as things wld have it we had to bring our 2 chihuahuas with us, therefor I had to find a hotel off the strip for us to stay in. I always expected to go to vegas and stay at the bellagio, venetian, or wynn - never a la quinta a few miles from the strip! And honestly, I am so glad we did! The hotel is brand new and super clean. Every morning I would see the hotel employees mopping the floors, or cleaning the outside. You can tell they are taking a lot of pride in their hotel. The room was spotless, and the bathroom was the cleanest hotel bathroom I had ever seen. The tv in the room was a flat screen and much larger then most hotel tvs. The 24 hr shuttle to the strip worked great for us, although it only leaves the hotel on the hour. Pick-up from the strip was slightly confusing. Sometimes we would call to be picked up and they would send the van right away, other times we had to wait almost 45 mins for them to send the shuttle. The hotel staff was hit and miss. I would say 90 percent were great, but there is always those few that make you feel like your inconveniencing them by being there. Overall I plan on staying here every time we come to Vegas, regardless of if we have our dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey14
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest La Quinta I have stayed in. Very clean rooms. The beds are comfortable! It is bed bug free, I ALWAYS check. It is a 5 minute drive from the strip. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: addle12
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed in 3 rooms here, the hotel seemed new,clean tidy and well maintained. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Free wifi coffee fridge and microwave in rooms. Close to airport but not noisy. Short drive to the Strip where we parked free at the Casinos. Free hourly shuttle from hotel was also available. Pool small and water q cold but still lovely. Business centre had 2 computers for guest use. Overall I highly recommend this place as a cheap but high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy4lou
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from the Cleveland Airport because my family and I were going to miss our airplane connection in Las Vegas, flying between Cleveland to Ontario, California. I chose it because it was close to the airport and had free shuttle service, especially important since we got in at 11:00 PM and flew out the next morning at 7:30. What we found here was a respite from a long wait in and long flight from the Cleveland Airport. We were promptly picked up at the airport, checked in to a large, well-appointed room, and slept heavenly in the king-sized bed adorned with wonderful lines. Before being shuttled back to the airport at 6:00 AM the next day, we enjoyed a fresh continental breakfast. Of course, we would stay here again under the same circumstances. However, we may even consider staying here when we intentionally visit Las Vegas to get away from the smoke-filled casinos and relax in the spacious rooms and next time enjoy the pool. Thank you, La Quinta staff, for comforting us on our journey.

Reviews.Title: “clean, but need to improve free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gio067
Reviews.Content: this hotel is clean and new & across the street from runway at airport. the rooms are nice so are the mattresses, it would be nice if pillows were firmer and bigger. they have a nice pool which you can see airplanes taking off and landing, the big complaint we and other travelers had is the free breakfast, its same old everyday! please la quinta offer some scrambled eggs and bacon that would be excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Off Strip”
Reviews.Author: FiftiesHavingFun
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and booked this hotel because of the close proximity to the airport. What a pleasant surprise! This hotel is not only "New", the rooms are very well appointed. Nice linens, comfortable beds, very friendly staff and the room was spotless. Beautiful pool area. Directly across from McCarran Airport it is very convenient to get to. We did not take advantage of this but the hotel offers a shuttle directly to the MGM Grand Hotel on the strip. I expected staying across from a major airport we would hear some noise but we did not. The hotel must have soundproof walls because we had an excellent nights rest before our trip to Zion National Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: BlueSkyMom
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on trip advisor recommendations and were not disappointed. It was perfect for our family of 5 with kids aged 8,6,4. The room was big enough for one night and we took advantage of the free roll away bed. The kids enjoyed the make your own waffles for breakfast while I loved the kuerig coffee maker in the room. The hotel is directly across the street from the airport but in our third floor rear facing room we never heard a single thing, it was super quiet. The hotel is also close to a north/ south thorough fare that worked well when we went down to the strip instead of taking las Vegas blvd. We were very satisfied and will stay again next time we are in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Strip, Stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: rosebud018
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel!!! Nice and quiet and looks brand new! The free breakfast was really nice, and the staff always had everything stocked and cleaned in a timely manner. The free shuttle was great!!!! took it to and from the strip, airport and town square! The only complaint was we could hear people in the hallway and in the next room but only for one night, and the plane noise wasn't bad at all! I would stay here in a heart beat next time I visit Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, reasonably priced and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jbh54
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ LaQuinta for 6 nights while visiting our son and his family who live in Las Vegas. We had reservations @ another hotel however, the facility did not meet our expectations and we checked out soon after we checked in. Our son suggested we call LaQuinta which is located near the airport It is under a year old and was spotless!! All the employees were very friendly and eager to assist us. I would highly recommend LaQuinta.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family and pets”
Reviews.Author: rjcro
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the week-end. we use la quintas all the time because they are the most pet friendly hotel chaotel

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of no-where”
Reviews.Author: Worldadventuress
Reviews.Content: Our flight was cancelled due to equipment failure. Couldn't get on another flight until the next morning. So I looked for a hotel close to the airport. This hotel sounds like it is close to the airport. But it took twice as long to get there than to the hotels down on the strip. It cost $10 more for the taxi.There is no room service and there is no where in walking distance to get anything, including dinner. We needed a glass of wine to relax. But, since this is a hotel owned by Mormons, they don't sell any. The van driver drove my husband to Walmart to purchase a bottle of wine and a few other things that we needed. Took forever for him to get home because the driver had to go pick up people at one of the hotels downtown on the strip and then to the airport. We ordered pizza from Dominoes for dinner. But by the time my husband made it back to the room, the pizza was cold.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, most likely will go back when passing through Vegas”
Reviews.Author: potostbo
Reviews.Content: Nice new motel south of the airport. Decent sized room with fridge and microwave. They gave a complimentary bag of cookies and two water bottles the one night we stayed. Only bad parts of the motel was the over complicated clock and the thin walls which was very evident with the loud neighboor talking at 1 am like it was 1 pm in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff and hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: aniedani
Reviews.Content: Huge room with refrigerator, coffee, tv and an incredible silence even nearness airport. The staff is outstanding. Hotel has gym, pool, spa and breakfast, that most of strip hotels doesn't have. You can have a relaxing stay and stay near the lights of strip or the other attractions of Vegas. And the price is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Best beds ever”
Reviews.Author: Kaybee50
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and the beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in. This is an excellent choice for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: briannegrace
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the La Quinta Inn and Suites Airport South in Las Vegas, Nevada last week along with about 45 of our wedding guests. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about the staff at this establishment. First of all we booked a block of rooms for our wedding party over 3 months ago. They made everything so easy from the start, our guests had no problem getting reservations. Our guests were beyond pleased at the wonderful room rate that we received and were more then ecstatic about the quality of the hotel. The front desk staff was very helpful from check in to check out. They were great with questions and replacing lost room keys and getting our rooms close together. They even hand delivered our welcome bags to each of the guests rooms so that they were waiting there when the guests arrived. On our wedding day we were supposed to take a shuttle to the wedding location just a few miles from the hotel, at first there was some confusion on the shuttle but instantly the front desk staff remedied the problem and got me (the crazy bride) and all of my bridal party to the wedding on time. Adam was our shuttle driver and although it was his job to drive us he acted as a counselor and was so pleasant to talk to he actually helped calm me and my anxious mother down during the drive to the wedding which was so helpful. (Lots of good wedding Karma going in Adams direction!!!!) We also had the opportunity to use one of the meeting rooms for a luncheon the day after our wedding for about 45 people who watched a slideshow, ate lunch and watched us open our wedding gifts. Adam (I am unsure of his last name) was so helpful in setting up the room exactly how we wanted it and making sure we had everything we needed to make our event run smoothly. The hotel and rooms were very clean, A MUST if you know my family. The pool was clean and nice, the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast area was always tidy and the food was fresh and delicious. The location is very convenient for people traveling from out of state and getting to and from the strip on the shuttle. I cannot thank you all enough for your kindness and outstanding customer service. You are all amazing and my family loved staying at your hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for catching an early flight & needing to return a rental car!”
Reviews.Author: Sedonamoon
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel & the entire place was super clean & pleasant! It is off the strip but has a 24 hour shuttle to the strip, airport, & a shopping center (drops off/picks up @ the MGM - a popular spot for hotel shuttles). The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on in a hotel - I want one for home! Our room was spacious & faced the airport runway - I couldn't believe how QUIET it was in room when the planes landed! The staff was pleasant & helpful. The breakfast was simple (not as expansive as the Staybridge Suites buffet) but adequate. The hotel is set back of the road a bit & the signage is not huge - once you find it though - it is well worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicci2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Las Vegas Airport South for 2 separate nights in May at the beginning and end of our trip. The free hotel shuttle which runs 24 hours picked us up at Terminal 2 (the hotel phone number listed at the courtesy phone at that terminal was incorrect), and we used the shuttle for other trips to and from the MGM, and also to the McCarran Rent-A-Car Center. There was a cooler with bottled water for passengers in the van. There is comfortable seating in the attractive lobby while waiting for the shuttle. Do allow extra time when using the shuttle as the driver tends to combine stops at the Town Square, strip, and airport on his run. We were delighted with both rooms we had: they are spacious, spotlessly clean, comfortable, equipped with large flat panel TV, good office chair and desk, microwave, fridge, Keurig one-cup coffee machine with assortment of coffee and tea, blackout drapes, comfortable bed with quality linens and pillows, and iron and ironing board. The bathroom is also tastefully appointed and has granite topped vanity and tub surround. There was no aircraft noise in our first room (#261) but there was faint noise from about 6am onwards in our second room facing the airport (#240) but nothing to complain about. Being a new hotel everything is in great condition. There are elevators, and the whole facility is non-smoking. Guest parking is free; there is no resort fee (unlike many strip hotels) and there are no slots. A business centre with computers and printer off the lobby is handy for internet use and printing boarding passes, etc. The breakfast available from 6 to 10 is very good, and the breakfast room kept clean and tidy by the staff. No Styrofoam or plastic cutlery is used. Hot and cold cereals, fresh fruit, juice, yogurt, various baked goods and bread, hard boiled eggs, waffles, coffee and tea are available. There is no restaurant at the hotel, but a local pizza place will deliver. For us the location was ideal, as it is close to the on- ramp to the I-15, the airport, and the car rental place. The hotel check-in time of 1pm was also convenient. Without exception we found the staff to be friendly, professional, helpful, and genuinely welcoming. The cookies in the lobby each evening, and the bottled water and cookies supplied in the room were little touches that enhanced our stay. For the AAA rate of $71.10 per night (plus tax) this hotel was a real bargain. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: jgaeto
Reviews.Content: I was in LV for a night and decided to stay at the La Quinta Inn. Overall, I was disappointed with my decision. For starters, the hotel wasn’t the easiest property to locate. The staff was courteous and accommodating but the room was not very desirable. The bedroom and bathroom areas were messy and displayed signs of a previous guest. I was surprised because I had heard such great reviews about this hotel but I certainly was not impressed. And the worst part about the stay was when I finally tried to fall asleep the air traffic from overhead kept me awake for 2+ hours!! Miserable!

Reviews.Title: “Wish all hotels were like this”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen625
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Hoover Dam. Super clean, extremely helpful staff and good breakfast for a great price. Even had a chance to spend some time at the great pool. Wish all hotels were like this.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jmwb
Reviews.Content: A brand new hotel handy for the airport. Good room, well equipped, comfy bed, nice pool, helpful staff, good breakfast. Only one thing: like other new hotels there is a big gap under the door, and the draft through my room to some kind of vent set up a very odd wailing noise. A towel to block the door helped a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for being off the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: dstringham
Reviews.Content: Hate Vegas. Smarmy, hot, and not kid/family friendly, but we have family that lives there. So we go. Thankfully we found the LQ Airport South and booked two nights. Pros: - Great central hub to traveling around Las Vegas and environs (Hoover Dam/Boulder, The Strip, if you want it) - Great kid-friendly pool (the towels! the towels!) - Great, well-stocked continental breakfast - Wireless internet FTW! - Clean, no smoking allowed (a plus for asthmatic children like ours) - Helpful staff (brought up a roll-away bed and comforter when we asked, fixed a lock issue within five minutes) Cons: - Wished our two-queen room was a tad larger (two kids in one bed, one on roll-away, one on the floor made for cozy quarters) - Rooms are sound-proofed well, but a bit of rumbling when the F-16s landed. We knew where we were staying, however, and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Novice2010
Reviews.Content: The airport sits between this hotel and the strip. The hotel is only four months old. The rooms have microwaves, flat-panel TVs and refrigerator. The amenities were good. There is a swimming pool which we did not use. The staff was hospitable. The hot breakfast was good. Very little airport noise. Easy to get to strip. Free hourly shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: Shellbbee
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights, and this hotel is perfect if you don't want to stay on the noisy and crowded strip! There is a shuttle to the MGM and Town Square. The rooms are very nice and the beds are super comfortable. The staff was always friendly and helpful! We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in an Unassuming Package”
Reviews.Author: toberead
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks ordinary from the outside, but it offers great luxury on the inside. I spent one night here after a vacation in Utah. I splurged on a whirlpool room (which was still pretty cheap) and I was very pleased. The whirlpool tub was huge and perfect for watching TV on the large flatscreen TV. The room was spotlessly clean and included a microwave and fridge. The king bed was very comfortable and the hotel was quiet. The hotel is located in an industrial area south of the airport, but there are a couple of nearby restaurants (including one that delivered) and it's only a short drive or shuttle trip to the strip. I took the shuttle to the airport the next morning - it was right on time and dropped me off in less than 15 minutes. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CorvetteTraveler77
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, March 23 and 24, 2011 in Room 341 and room 343 (two travelers) for business trip to convention center in Las Vegas. Rate was $80.10 for first night and $89.72 for the second night. This is a new property (six months old) just on the south side of the Las Vegas airport. The rooms are good, clean, large, good beds, flat screen TV, free internet, quite. Standard La Quinta free breakfast. There is a business office with two computers and printer. Front desk service was excellent. Property has two vans and will provide free (tips to driver) to the MGM on the strip, airport and the car rental center. Everyone working here is friendly and helpful. We used the van for service to the MGM and then the tram or bus to the convention center. This worked great for us and total trip time was about 30 minutes. Great value and good place to stay while in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel perfect for visiting las Vegas and nearby national parks”
Reviews.Author: indico85
Reviews.Content: I rented a car and planned to visit Las Vegas, Death Valley, Red Rock and the Valley of Fire. This Hotel was in a perfect location for my visits. There were plenty of complementary hotel parking. When I went to visit the las vegas strip, it was only a 7 min drive away and I parked for free in Planet Hollywood and MgM. The hotel was very clean, very comfortable bed and very friendly staff. On arrival they give you 2 bottles of water. You have a microwave and fridge in your room and a vending machine, water and ice on each floor. In the evening they leave out free cookies at the reception desk and there is always a big bowl of peppermints. In the morning from 6 to 10 they serve a complimentary breakfast. They have cereal, waffles, juice, fruit, yogurt and bagels. Also they have free high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Niezatycze
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were vacationing in St. George UT, but flew in and out of Las Vegas. We decided to spend the day and night before we flew out at this new La Quinta, which is adjacent to McCarran airport. The room was spacious with adjacent sleeping and sitting areas. We never heard an airplane inside our room even though the airport is close by. The staff was helpful. The usual kind of breakfast was included. The strip was an easy ride away in our rental car. Best of all the room was a great bargain at less than $80

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Elder
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised with the quality of this hotel.
