Be aware that there are TWO Airport La Quintas in Las Vegas, and I must have been looking at the other one's reviews before, because I expected a lot worse. As many others have said, the facility is very new (it still has a "NOW OPEN" banner hanging outside), and it was spotless. It is right across the street from the runway of the airport, so you can see the big planes landing all the time, which my kids loved. The soundproofing is pretty good inside, too. You can hear the occasional jet engine humming, but it's really not bad at all. The only downside to the hotel is that they are so new that they still have a problem showing up properly on GPS and Google Maps. My Google map printoff took me to the north side of the airport, when the hotel is on the south side. When it was clear that we were lost, though, a quick call to the hotel put us in touch with a helpful front desk employee who very kindly gave us great directions. My Dad's GPS also sent him to the other airport La Quinta, so be sure you specify the South location. Breakfast had a lot of choices, and was good enough. We never went away hungry, and a free meal is hard to beat for a family of five. The WiFi is also free, which is not usually the case in most hotels I stay in. And, the price was terrific. We got my family of five (wife and I plus two kids and a baby) into one room for <$60 per night! That is a killer deal, and coupled with all the free perks, can't be beat. If we ever go back to Vegas again, we know where we're staying!

Reviews.Title: “Very new hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzeQ1
Reviews.Content: This hotel must have just opened and is very nice-large rooms with lots of granite, flat screen, very good breakfast, good beds, quiet, good service. We stayed one night on trip to California and this hotel had good access to the freeway without being right on it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended if you don't mind being off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: ebony53
Reviews.Content: Our flight home was cancelled and we were given this hotel. Staff was excellent, rooms new and very clean, included coffee pot, microwave and fridge which most hotels on the strip don't include. Overall it is an excellent hotel--very quiet. Shuttle will take you to the strip or shopping. They were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Far beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: roamingvix
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Las Vegas airport from San Francisco and was due to fly straight onto New York but due to poor weather conditions our flight was cancelled and we reluctantly had to spend the night in Las Vegas. La Quinta was recommended to us by Virgin America staff and for $69 we were not expecting much, but were very pleasantly suprised. We were collected from the airport within minutes of contacting the hotel and were pleased to find the hotel on a quiet road but could see the 'Strip' from our room. The reception staff (special mention to Jenifer) were so helpful and friendly and made us feel immediately welcome and at ease, and liased with the airline on our behalf regarding our lost luggage. Our room was hugh and spotlessly clean, had two double beds which were the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. The hotel ran a shuttle bus to and from the Strip as well as the airport, which seemed to depart whenever you wanted them to and could pick you up with only a phone call. A lovely man called Jon ferried us to and from the airport several times to organise our departure and is a great asset to the La Quinta team. Although we were not fans of Las Vegas, La Quinta made our stay a very pleasurable and pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Wanting2seetheworld
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about the hotels I stay in so I went off the reviews here on trip advisor. The reviews are right on the money. This place was the best La Quinta I have stayed at. I love La Quinta because they are pet friendly. We traveled with our two cats, and they were very helpful there as they put us on the first floor to help us with our luggage. Everything looks brand new! Bathroom was super clean!! I am very picky so this hotel was perfect by me.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel -- best value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: brickpilot
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and both agreed that this was the nicest hotel experience we have ever had. What a terrific value! We actually stayed in 3 separate rooms on 3 nights during our stay. We had reserved the first night, liked it so much we put ourselves on the waiting list for a second night (it was booked up when we checked out at first but fortunately there was a cancellation) and then reserved a third night before our departure from the LV airport. All 3 rooms were gorgeous, nicer than places I've spent 3 to 4 times as much for. Tasteful furniture, attractive artwork, spacious and deluxe bathrooms, large TVs and the most heavenly plush beds and bedding imaginable, a giant marshmallow of a bed with a fluffy duvet and piles of fat pillows, all crisp and fresh-smelling. We didn't want to get up! The entire hotel is clean, serene and well appointed, a real haven. The rooms have the warm feel of a guest suite in an elegant private home. The free breakfast was great, with yummy hot waffles, fresh fruit, juices, cereals, yogurts and pastries. The location is away from the mobs and noise of the strip and casinos but really handy to the airport or a quick drive into town or out of it. Since we were planning to drive to visit Death Valley and the Mojave Desert it was perfect, location-wise. The staff were utterly delightful: cheerful, efficient and friendly and absolutely helpful with everything. Adam and Yahiri on the evening shift were just wonderful. We felt like they were our private personal assistants. There was a sense that everyone who worked there was proud of the hotel and dedicated to keeping it running smoothly. We will be back, and we will definitely look for other La Quinta hotels in our other travels. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Captainkate1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was surprizingly nice. I had stayed at a La Quinta before and that one was not much better than Motel 6. This one is very convenient to the airport, the decor is very nice, the beds were comfy, room was very clean. Nice enough breakfast My only objection was that the staff was not terribly helpful. They either couldn't or wouldn't get travel weather information for me. (the room had no weather channel). Other than that I would reccommend this hotel for a comfy night's sleep and an above average breakfast. They take pets! That was great. No extra charge.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Las Vegas Airport South
HotelInfo.Address: 6560 Surrey St, Las Vegas, NV 89119
